concept.title: Carburetor Leakage Causes
concept.shortdesc: Carburetor leakage typically occurs when debris interferes with the float needle mechanism, preventing proper fuel flow regulation.

section.title: Float Needle Operation
section.p: The flow of gasoline into the carburetor through the feed pipe is controlled by the float needle's vertical movement in its seat. This automatic regulation system maintains proper fuel levels in the carburetor bowl.

section.title: Common Cause of Leakage
section.p: When dirt particles become lodged in the needle seat, they can prevent the needle from properly sealing. This malfunction causes gasoline to overflow from the carburetor bowl and leak onto the ground.
